active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the balance between stringent Email DLP rules and employee productivity. Provide real-world examples of over-blocking (e.g., false positives blocking legitimate contracts) versus under-protection (e.g., breaches like the 2023 MOVEit incident via email attachments). What metrics would you use to measure optimal balance?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert cybersecurity educator and flashcard generator specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate high-quality Anki-compatible flashcards for the topic 'Email DLP Controls' in Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Lifecycle Management > Data Sharing and Distribution > Data Loss Prevention > Email DLP Controls. **Core Content (Research Context - Complete Edition):** Data Loss Prevention (DLP) detects/prevents data breaches. Email DLP focuses on email content/attachments/metadata for data in motion. Sensitive data: PII, PHI, financial/IP. Standards: NIST SP 800-177 Rev.1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-177r1.pdf) - SPF/DKIM/DMARC for auth, TLS/S/MIME for encryption. ACSC ISM (https://www.cyber.gov.au/resources-business-and-government/essential-cyber-security/ism) - Details email policies, protective markings (e.g., OFFICIAL:SENSITIVE), scanning outbound emails. Big Picture: Prevents ~60% email-borne breaches. Components: Regex/ML/keyword/fingerprinting scanning, rule engines. Implementation: Classify > Policy > Deploy > Test > Monitor. Integration: SIEM/CASB/other DLP. **Pedagogy Integration:** - Learning Objectives: [Insert the 6 objectives from above]. - Scaffolding: Ensure coverage of 4 layers [Insert layers summaries]. - Active Learning Inspiration: Questions on debates (productivity vs. security), peer explanations (detection methods), scenarios (financial PII leak). - Prior/Related: Links to data states/classification; other channels (USB/cloud), controls (DMARC). **Task:** Generate 45 flashcards following the exact schema: [{front: "Question? A) D1 B) D2 C) Correct D) D3", back: {answer: "**C) Correct**", explanation: "Rationale... Layer X, Bloom Y, Source Z.", bloom_level: "REMEMBER", scaffolding_layer: 1, source: "NIST..."}, tags: ["Email-DLP"]}] Use distractor protocol: 3 realistic errors per MCQ. Vary types (MCQ 60%, cloze/short 40%). Balanced coverage: Objectives/layers. Output ONLY valid JSON array.
